title: MyType - Exhibition: Extended until May 18th!
content:
/// Due to popular demand! MyType has been extended to May 18th. ///

the exhibit will now show until Sunday, May 18th...make sure to check it out!  
designer Noel Nanton will be closing the show with a talk about ’his’type...  
Sunday May 18th at 3pm, this is a free event.  
see below for MyType details and exhibit location...

—-

typotherapy+design, Keep Six Contemporary Gallery and the Festival of  
Architecture and Design invite you to:

MyType: An exhibit of limited-edition, new modernist  
posters by graphic design genius Noel Nanton.

Exhibition dates: May 2- May 18th. 2008

Keep Six Contemporary Gallery 938 Bathurst Street, Toronto, Canada.  
Free Admission.

Featuring new fonts designed by typotherapy, eye-popping popsicle colours, bold abstract shapes, and a very new take on classic modernist typography.

Starting with the premise that typefaces are as expressive as the words they form, typotherapy has created a series of large-format posters that explore the relationship between positive and negative space. Letters speak, and if you remove them from the constraints of sentences and even words, they have a language of their own.

MyType uses the craft of typography to find new ways of speaking using fonts famous and unknown including Helvetica, Avant Garde and typotherapy creations like Tomeri and VWmobile.

For more information visit: [www.keep6c.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121114258/http:/www.keep6c.com/ "www.keep6c.com") and [www.toronto.ca/fad](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121114258/http:/www.toronto.ca/fad "www.toronto.ca/fad")  
For more new modernist design genius, visit: [www.typotherapy.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121114258/http:/www.typotherapy.com/ "www.typotherapy.com")
